question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [ID Reuse] If Sui allows object ID reuse after deletion, can oracle_queue_id point to a deleted Queue's ID that gets reused for a different object type, causing type confusion? (High)

Can pointing to a not-yet-created future Queue ID cause failures? (High)

(High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [State Getter Usage] The actuate() function calls state.oracle_queue() to get old value - if this getter function has side effects or caches values, can it introduce unexpected behavior or staleness issues? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Module Coupling] Does the tight coupling with on_demand::set_oracle_queue_id create upgrade risks? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [State Object Sharing] Since State is a shared object, can concurrent transactions from other modules modify State fields while run() is executing, causing inconsistent oracle_queue_id updates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Module: set_oracle_queue_id_action] [Upgrade Path] If this action module is upgraded, can the new version introduce breaking changes that make historical OracleQueueIdSet events incompatible with new event schema? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [Gas Exhaustion] Can repeatedly calling run() with different oracle_queue_id values exhaust gas limits or cause transaction failures due to excessive State object mutations? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Event Storage] If OracleQueueIdSet events are stored on-chain, can spamming run() fill up event storage and increase query costs for off-chain systems? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Function: actuate()] [Cascade Failure] If changing oracle_queue_id causes all active vault operations to fail (due to oracle queue mismatch), can this be weaponized to DoS the entire vault system? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [Same Value Update] Can run() be called with oracle_queue_id equal to current State.oracle_queue? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/actions/state/set_oracle_queue_id_action.move] [Function: run()] [Rapid Succession] If run() is called multiple times in rapid succession (different blocks but close together), can vault operations get confused about which oracle_queue_id to use?
